--- title: "Simple Linear Regression" title-slide-attributes: data-background-image: images/lake.jpg data-background-size: contain data-background-opacity: "0.5" subtitle: "Math 155: Modern Statistics with Computer Analysis" author: "Bastola" format: revealjs: html-math-method: mathjax mathjax-url: "https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/3.2.2/MathJax.js" theme: [default, scss/main.scss] slide-number: true preview-links: auto history: true chalkboard: src: drawings.json transition: slide background-transition: fade touch: false controls: true --- ## What is Simple Linear Regression? {.font80} ::: cle6 - **Goal**: Predict a dependent variable (outcome) based on one independent variable (predictor). - **Method**: Fit the best line through the data points in a scatterplot. - **Formula for Line**: $y = \beta_0 + \beta_1x + \epsilon$ - **Correlation Coefficient $r$**: $$ r = \frac{1}{n-1}\sum \bigg(\frac{x - \bar{x}}{s_x} \bigg)\bigg(\frac{y - \bar{y}}{s_y} \bigg) $$ - This formula expresses the sample correlation coefficient using deviations from the mean. ::: ## Sample Data: Coffee Consumption and Productivity (n = 10) {.font60} | Hour of the Day | Productivity Score | |-----------------|--------------------| | 1 | 1.5 | | 2 | 3.5 | | 3 | 2.3 | | 4 | 4.8 | | 5 | 5.2 | | 6 | 7.4 | | 7 | 6.9 | | 8 | 8.0 | | 9 | 8.5 | | 10 | 10.1 | - **Hour of the Day**: Time since start of work (hours) - **Productivity Score**: Measured on a scale where higher values indicate better focus and output **Context**: Observing the impact of coffee consumed at the beginning of the day on hourly productivity scores. The data explores whether productivity peaks post-coffee consumption. ## Visualizing Data and Regression Line {.font80} ::: {.cell} ::: {.cell-output-display} ![](Day40_155_files/figure-revealjs/unnamed-chunk-1-1.png){width=960} ::: ::: ## Example: Associations in Car dataset {.font80}

Various Associations of quantitative variables in Cars data
## Car Correlations {.font80}

Correlations of various variables in Cars data
## ```{=html} ``` ## Correlation Does Not Imply Causation {.font70} ::: cle10 #### Ice Cream Sales vs. Swimming Pool Accidents - Both increase in summer, driven by warmer weather, not causation. #### Firefighters at a Scene vs. Damage - Larger fires need more firefighters; more firefighters do not cause more damage. #### Shoe Size and Reading Ability in Children - Both shoe size and reading skills increase with age. ::: ## [Link to Minitab App](https://app.minitab.com/) ::: row ::: left ::: ::: right ::: ::: ## Does Correlation Does Imply Causation? Why? {.font60} ::: cle10 #### Group 1: Social Media Use and Academic Performance
Answer - Lower grades correlate with more social media usage, but causation is not direct.
#### Group 2: Organic Food Consumption and Health
Answer - Healthier individuals might choose organic foods, other healthy behaviors are involved.
#### Group 3: Pirates and Global Warming
Answer - Decrease in pirates correlates with increase in global temperatures, clearly not causative.
#### Group 4: Coffee Shops and Property Values
Answer - Higher property values attract more coffee shops, not the other way around.
:::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
